intro: Beilschmiedia djalonensis, commonly known as the West African beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of West Africa. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers followed by edible, orange-colored berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It typically grows to a height of 15–20 meters and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable in its native range.
